revised_title: Comparative Analysis of Meteorological Data from Kew, Nertchinsk, and Barnaoul
tldr: This article presents the results of the first year's performance of the photographically self-recording meteorological instruments at Kew Observatory, comparing the data with two other stations in Siberia. The study examines diurnal variations in temperature, elasticity of aqueous vapor, barometric pressure, pressure of dry air, and humidity, highlighting differences and similarities between the three stations.
